BACK_PAIN_YEARS: Since how many years you have back pain?
RED_FLAG_DESCRIPTION: Please answer these questions honestly. If you answer 'YES' to any question, the app may not be suitable for you at this time.
RED_FLAG_Q1: Have you had a recent major injury or trauma to your back?
RED_FLAG_Q2: Are you experiencing unexplained weight loss?
RED_FLAG_Q3: Do you have numbness or tingling in your groin or inner thighs (saddle area)?
RED_FLAG_Q4: Are you experiencing new problems with controlling your bladder or bowels?
RED_FLAG_Q5: Do you have a history of cancer?
RED_FLAG_Q6: Are you experiencing severe night pain that prevents sleep?
RED_FLAG_ALERT_MESSAGE: Based on your answers, your symptoms may require immediate medical attention. Please consult a doctor or go to the nearest emergency department. This app is not suitable for you at this time.
PAIN_LOCALIZATION_DESCRIPTION: Tap on the areas where you feel pain
START_BACK_DESCRIPTION: Please answer the following 9 questions about your back pain
START_BACK_Q1: In the past 2 weeks, have you been able to get relief from your back pain by changing positions or by lying down?
START_BACK_Q2: In the past 2 weeks, have you had back pain that has spread down your leg(s) at any time?
START_BACK_Q3: In the past 2 weeks, have you had pins and needles, tingling, or numbness in any part of your leg(s) at any time?
START_BACK_Q4: In the past 2 weeks, have you been bothered by worrying about your back pain?
START_BACK_Q5: In the past 2 weeks, have you been bothered by feeling that your back pain is terrible and it's never going to get any better?
START_BACK_Q6: In the past 2 weeks, have you been bothered by feeling down, depressed, or hopeless?
START_BACK_Q7: In the past 2 weeks, have you been bothered by feeling tense, anxious, or uptight?
START_BACK_Q8: In the past 2 weeks, have you been bothered by feeling irritable or easily angered?
START_BACK_Q9: Overall, how bothersome has your back pain been in the past 2 weeks?
QUESTION: Question
RMDQ_DESCRIPTION: Please answer all 24 questions. Check Yes if the statement applies to you today because of your back pain.
RMDQ_Q1: I stay at home most of the time because of my back pain.
RMDQ_Q2: I change position frequently to try to get my back comfortable.
RMDQ_Q3: I walk more slowly than usual because of my back pain.
RMDQ_Q4: Because of my back pain, I am not doing any of the jobs that I usually do around the house.
RMDQ_Q5: Because of my back pain, I use a handrail to get upstairs.
RMDQ_Q6: Because of my back pain, I lie down to rest more often.
RMDQ_Q7: Because of my back pain, I have to hold on to something to get out of an easy chair.
RMDQ_Q8: Because of my back pain, I try to get other people to do things for me.
RMDQ_Q9: I get dressed more slowly than usual because of my back pain.
RMDQ_Q10: I only stand for short periods of time because of my back pain.
RMDQ_Q11: Because of my back pain, I try not to bend or kneel down.
RMDQ_Q12: I find it difficult to get out of a chair because of my back pain.
RMDQ_Q13: My back pain is worse when I am lying down.
RMDQ_Q14: I find it difficult to turn over in bed because of my back pain.
RMDQ_Q15: My appetite is not very good because of my back pain.
RMDQ_Q16: I have trouble putting on my socks (or stockings) because of my back pain.
RMDQ_Q17: I walk only short distances because of my back pain.
RMDQ_Q18: I sleep less well because of my back pain.
RMDQ_Q19: Because of my back pain, I get dressed with help from someone else.
RMDQ_Q20: I sit down for most of the day because of my back pain.
RMDQ_Q21: I avoid heavy jobs around the house because of my back pain.
RMDQ_Q22: Because of my back pain, I am more irritable and bad tempered with people than usual.
RMDQ_Q23: Because of my back pain, I go upstairs more slowly than usual.
RMDQ_Q24: I stay in bed most of the time because of my back pain.
VAS_DESCRIPTION: Please rate your current average pain over the last week
ABOUT_DESCRIPTION: A self-management program for low back pain
STEP_1_DESC: Answer questions about your back pain
STEP_3_DESC: Log pain daily and see your improvement
LOG_PAIN_DESCRIPTION: Rate your pain level on a scale from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst pain imaginable)
NO_PAIN_LOGS_YET: No pain logs yet. Start tracking your pain to see progress!
NO_EXERCISES_DESCRIPTION: Exercises will appear here once your weekly plan is generated.
LOGIN_FAILED: Login failed. Please check your credentials.
SAVE_FAILED: Failed to save. Please try again.
TIPS_DESC: Helpful tips for managing back pain
TIP_1: Maintain good posture while sitting and standing
TIP_2: Take regular breaks to stretch and move
TESTIMONIAL_1: This app has helped me track my progress and stay motivated. Highly recommended!
TESTIMONIAL_2: The exercises are easy to follow and the daily tracking keeps me accountable.
MOTIVATIONAL_QUOTE_1: Every small step counts on your journey to recovery
